content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 244.5 - CSAPR NO[x] Annual New Unit Set-aside Allocations

State Regulations
(a) For each control period, the department
will determine distributions of CSAPR NO
x

Annual
allowances to any CSAPR NO
x

Annual unit in New York

State that did not receive an allocation for the control period pursuant to
section
244.3
(b)(2)
of
this part (including an allocation of zero allowances), in accordance with the
following procedures: (1)

The department will
establish a CSAPR NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside
allocation for each control period not to exceed five percent of the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual Budget set forth in section
244.3
of this part
(2)

Only CSAPR NO
x

Annual units may receive CSAPR NO
x

Annual allowances
from the CSAPR NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside allocations
established in paragraph (1) of this subdivision. (3)
CSAPR NO
x

Annual
new unit set-aside allowances may be transferred to CSAPR
NO
x

Annual units for no more than eight consecutive
control periods, starting with the latter of the 2017 control period or the
control period during which the CSAPR NO
x

Annual unit
commenced, or is projected to commence, operation and ending with the control
period preceding the first control period for which the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual unit will receive an allocation pursuant to
paragraph 244.3(b)(2) of this part. (4)

The designated representative of a CSAPR
NO
x

Annual unit must submit a written request to the
department to reserve for the CSAPR NO
x

Annual unit a
number of CSAPR NO
x

Annual allowances in the relevant
CSAPR NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside account in an amount
no greater than the number representing the unit's potential to emit. The
reservation request must be submitted prior to January 1st of the control
period to which the reservation request pertains. The department will not
consider any request for the reservation of CSAPR NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside allowances submitted prior to the issuance of all
permits and authorizations by the department that are necessary for operation
of the CSAPR NO
x

Annual unit. The reservation request
must include information detailing the potential to emit of the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual unit. (5)

Subject to the number of CSAPR
NO
x

Annual allowances allocated to each new unit
set-aside account, following department approval of the request for reservation
of CSAPR NO
x

Annual allowances, the department will
reserve CSAPR NO
x

Annual allowances in the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside account before the start
of the control period for which the CSAPR NO
x

Annual
unit will receive an allocation pursuant to subdivision (a) of this section in
an amount no greater than the CSAPR NO
x

Annual unit's
potential to emit. (6)

If more than
one CSAPR NO
x

Annual unit requests the reservation of
CSAPR NO
x

Annual allowances and the number of requested
allowances exceeds the allocation to the relevant CSAPR NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside account, the department will reserve
CSAPR NO
x

Annual allowances from the account for the
units in the order in which the CSAPR NO
x

Annual units
submitted approvable reservation requests. For the purposes of this paragraph, requests will be considered simultaneous if they are made in the same calendar
quarter. Should approvable reservation requests in excess of the allocation to
the relevant CSAPR NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside account
be submitted in the same calendar quarter by different CSAPR
NO
x

Annual units, the department will reserve CSAPR
NO
x

Annual allowances for those units on a basis
proportional to the number of CSAPR NO
x

Annual
allowances requested by each CSAPR NO
x

Annual
unit. (7)

By July 1st of each year, the department will submit a request to the Administrator, in a format
prescribed by the Administrator, to transfer reserved CSAPR
NO
x

Annual allowances to the compliance account of the
CSAPR NO
x

Annual source that includes the relevant CSAPR
NO
x

Annual unit in an amount no greater than the number
representing the unit's potential to emit. (8)

After the Administrator makes the
deductions for compliance under
40 CFR
97.424
(see Table 1, section 200.9 of this
title) for a control period, the department will determine whether any CSAPR
NO
x

Annual allowances remain in the CSAPR
NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside account for the control
period. By the July 1st following the control period, the department will
transfer any remaining CSAPR NO
x

Annual allowances from
the CSAPR NO
x

Annual new unit set-aside account to the
EERET account. Allowances transferred to the EERET account will be available
for sale or other disposition in accordance with section
244.6
of this part. Notes
